alert.note: Alert for Knox (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 10:07PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Knox County through 1100 PM EDT... At 1007 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Holmesville to near Loudonville to near Bellville to 7 miles southwest of Lexington. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. Winds are mainly with a gust front ahead of the line of storms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Vernon, Fredericktown, Gambier, Utica, Danville, Waterford, Martinsburg, Gann, North Liberty and Bladensburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for north central Ohio.
